Class FlightBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.model.FlightBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class FlightBoard extends Object implements Serializable
Represents the flight board used during the space phase of the game.

A FlightBoard is a track where players move forward based on engine power, with different lengths and reward structures depending on the game phase (TRIAL or LEVEL2).

  • Constructor Details

    • FlightBoard

      public FlightBoard(FlightBoard.Type type)
      Constructs a FlightBoard of the given type, initializing its length and rewards.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of the flight board (FlightBoard.Type.TRIAL or FlightBoard.Type.LEVEL2)

  • Method Details

    • getType

      public FlightBoard.Type getType()
      Returns the type of this flight board.
      Returns:
      the type of the board (TRIAL or LEVEL2)

    • getLength

      public int getLength()
      Returns the total length of the flight board (i.e., the maximum position on the track).
      Returns:
      the length of the flight board

    • getFinishOrderRewards

      public ArrayList<Integer> getFinishOrderRewards()
      Returns the list of rewards assigned to the first four players that finish the race.

      The reward values are ordered by arrival position (first to fourth).

      Returns:
      the list of coin rewards based on arrival order

    • getBestLookingReward

      public int getBestLookingReward()
      Returns the coin reward for the best-looking ship.
      Returns:
      the reward for the most aesthetic ship

    • initializePosition

      public void initializePosition(Player player, int pos)
      Initializes the starting position of the given player on the flight board, based on their draft position (1 to 4). The starting position differs between TRIAL and LEVEL2 boards.
      Parameters:
      player - the player whose position is being initialized
      pos - an integer from 1 to 4 representing the player's initial draft position
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided position is not between 1 and 4, or if the board type is unrecognized
